intro: Synostemon albiflorus, commonly known as the whiteflower synostemon, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its most distinctive characteristic is the clusters of small, white, tubular flowers that bloom in the summer. Synostemon albiflorus is typically found in moist, wooded areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
